revised_title: Groundwater Pumping and Subsidence in Layered Soil Systems
tldr: This article examines the mechanics of intensive groundwater pumping from layered soil systems, focusing on the case where pumping is so strong that ground subsidence, mainly contributed by the soft aquitard, is comparable to the typical layer thickness. The authors develop a theoretical model that accounts for compaction in the aquitards and show that the total stress is not necessarily uniform in depth. They also discuss the variations of soil parameters due to various forms of cyclic pumping or recharging.
scientific_discipline: Environmental and Earth Sciences > Soil Mechanics
